page.title: 03CHANGING FACE OF SALTBURN.
page.content: Saltburn today is a small community town whose population has grown slowly over the years. Once it was a popular spa town and tourist resort but now caters for day visitors from nearby towns and villages. Bathing machines, pierrots, brass bands and a theatre were popular in the early 1900's. Sadly they no longer exist giving way to amusement arcades. Within the town everybody knew each other and policemen were familiar figures walking the beat. Saltburn was part of the countryside with its Victorian housing overlooking open fields. People would travel by horse drawn cart or cycle. The shops, with food supplied by local farmers, met the needs of the town. Today people pass through Saltburn on the coast road to places such as Whitby, Redcar and Scarborough.(J.Croker,F.Roughton)
